channel.title: Really easy java coding question
channel.description:
I don't know anything about coding so i wanted to ask how to make this code work and for future reference how to do something like it correctly, instead of leaching off of the server's coding.
[code]Public int() if +PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ = 1 playerword = person is if +PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ > 1 playerword = people are[/code]
I'm just trying to make it say "person is" if only 1 person is playing, and "people are" if more than one person is playing.

item.title: Really easy java coding question
item.dc:creator: @adamp40 adamp40
item.description:
@adamp40 wrote:

[code]Public int()
if PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount();
if PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount = 1;
playerword = person is
if PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount();
if PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount > 1;
playerword = people are

[/code]

Cant you do that?

Read full topic

item.title: Really easy java coding question
item.dc:creator: @hamster40 hamster40
item.description:
@hamster40 wrote:

Hey, i fixed most of it, i just need to fix this part. The ">, and = "aren’t working

if (+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ = 1); { playerword() = "person is"; } if (+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ > 1); { playerword() = "people are"; }

Read full topic

item.title: Really easy java coding question
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Oh, add that line right there into your initialize method.

sendmessage(@red@"There are currently "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ +playerword+");

Read full topic

item.title: Really easy java coding question
item.dc:creator: @hamster40 hamster40
item.description:
@hamster40 wrote:

Here’s the rest of my coding, it should explain…

		sendmessage(@red@"There are currently "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount()+ +playerword+");

I’m making this message show up when a person logs in, any ideas Kihomura?

Read full topic
